basics.name: Indu Kant Deo
basics.label: Research Scientist
basics.summary: A research scientist with a strong background in mechanical engineering, specializing in physics-based machine learning for solving partial differential equations and predicting fluid flow.

work.name: Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory
work.position: Data Science Summer Institute Intern @ libROM Team
work.summary: Collaborated with interdisciplinary teams to develop data-driven models for large-scale metal 3D printing, working across domains including scientific machine learning, additive manufacturing, and fluid dynamics.
highlights: Performed large-scale simulations on 112 HPC cores with Ansys Mechanical for additive manufacturing data
Developed a parameterized graph convolutional autoencoder for predicting distortion
Developed a POD-GP reduced-order model (ROM), and benchmarked it against the graph autoencoder
Applied Gaussian Process Regression to quantify uncertainty in the ROM predictions
Predicted distortion within 1e-3 mm in LPBF simulation and achieved speed-up by 1800 times using POD-GP

work.name: Clear Seas
work.summary: Developed real-time underwater noise prediction models using physics-informed machine learning for marine environmental research.
highlights: Leveraged high-performance computing (HPC) to generate large-scale acoustic datasets using BELLHOP solver
Developed a range-conditional convolutional neural network (RC-CAN) for predicting transmission loss
Introduced a continual learning framework for training dynamical systems with varying bathymetry

work.name: Computational Multi-physics Lab, UBC
work.summary: Conducting advanced research in machine learning models for spatial-temporal data, focusing on convolutional autoencoders and attention-based neural networks.
highlights: Developed convolutional autoencoder and attention-based RNN for time-series forecasting, improving performance by 5x compared to RNN-LSTM
Presented results at international conferences and published findings in the Artificial Intelligence issue of Physics of Fluids
Built a space-time ROM utilizing a 3D convolution kernel for fluid flow prediction, published in Physics of Fluids

work.name: Autonomous Ground Vehicle Research Lab, IIT Kharagpur
work.summary: Led the development of vision modules and algorithms for autonomous vehicles, with a focus on deep learning and image processing.
highlights: Developed a new vision module using deep learning to upgrade image processing methods, improving computational efficiency and FPS
Devised a lane detection algorithm using machine learning, improving accuracy by 10%
Published lane-detection algorithm in IEEE conference on Control, Automation, Robotics, and Vision
Led team to 2nd place in the Autonomous Navigation Challenge at Oakland University, USA

education.thesis: Physics-based machine learning for solving partial differential equations and predicting fluid flow
Data-driven pattern recognition in MRI data of blood flowing through the heart

publications.name: Data-Driven, Parameterized Reduced-order Models for Predicting Distortion in Metal 3D Printing
publications.summary: Collaborative work on parameterized reduced-order models for metal 3D printing, highlighting efficiency in predicting distortion.

publications.name: Harnessing Loss Decomposition for Long-Horizon Wave Predictions via Deep Neural Networks
publications.summary: Exploring loss decomposition techniques to improve long-horizon predictions using deep neural networks.

publications.name: Continual Learning of Range-Dependent Transmission Loss for Underwater Acoustics Using Conditional Convolutional Neural Net
publications.summary: Research on employing continual learning in neural networks for transmission loss predictions in underwater acoustics.

publications.name: A Multi-Objective Optimization Framework for Reducing the Impact of Ship Noise on Marine Mammals
publications.summary: Developed a multi-objective optimization framework to mitigate the impact of ship noise on marine mammals.

publications.name: Combined Space-Time Reduced-Order Model with 3D Deep Convolution for Extrapolating Fluid Dynamics
publications.summary: Developed a space-time reduced-order model for fluid dynamics simulation using a 3D convolutional neural network, selected as Editor's Pick.

projects.name: Hypergraph Message Passing Network for Fluid Dynamics Simulations
projects.summary: Developed a hypergraph message passing network to enhance fluid dynamics simulations, achieving improved time prediction compared to existing models.

projects.name: Deep Learning for Extrapolating Fluid Dynamics
projects.summary: Conceptualized and implemented a temporal convolutional neural network (CNN) for extrapolating beyond the training regime, improving time-forecasting accuracy by 15%.

volunteer.organization: Autonomous Ground Vehicle Lab, IIT Kharagpur
volunteer.summary: Managed a student design team of 40 UG students, developing vision modules for autonomous vehicles and organizing weekly meetings to ensure project milestones were met.
Delivered tutorials and lab sessions for Data Science 100, Introduction to Probability, and Statistical Inferences courses at UBC, contributing to the education of over 300 students.
